comments.content: Sounds like it could be a timing belt issue. You should get it checked!
I had the same problem with my Accord. Turned out to be low oil levels.
BFGoodrich KO2s are amazing for off-road! Highly recommend.
Depends on your budget. Falken Wildpeak is a good balance of price and performance.
Try getting an OBD2 scanner to read the error codes. Could be anything!
Mine was due to a loose gas cap. Check that first!
Borla and Flowmaster make some of the best exhaust systems for Mustangs.
Go for a cat-back system. It improves sound and performance.
You probably have mold in your AC vents. Try using an AC cleaner spray.
Changing the cabin air filter can help. Also, run the AC on full blast for a few minutes.
